info.headline: Freeze Warning issued January 07 at 8:31AM PST until January 09 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM MONDAY TO 8 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility less than 1/4 mile in dense fog. For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. * WHERE...Bakersfield, Planada - Le Grand - Snelling, South End San Joaquin Valley, Southeast San Joaquin Valley, and Visalia - Porterville - Reedley. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until noon PST today. For the Freeze Warning, from 2 AM Monday to 8 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Clouds banking up against the foothill areas will create hazardous driving conditions through the late morning hours with visibilities below 1/4 mile.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
